questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct statement
question_texts: Choose the correct statement

options.option_text: Quasi linear preferences are linear in one good and non‐linear in other good
Marginal utility changes for a monotonic transformation of the utility function
MRS does not change for a monotonic transformation of utility function
All of these

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct alternative
question_texts: Choose the correct alternative

options.option_text: The fraction of quantity tax paid by buyers rises as supply becomes less own‐price elastic
The fraction of quantity tax paid by buyers rises as demand becomes moreown‐price elastic
Both the fraction of quantity tax paid by buyers rises as supply becomes less own‐price elastic& the fraction of quantity tax paid by buyers rises as demand becomes more own‐price elastic
None

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct alternative about a monopolist
question_texts: Choose the correct alternative about a monopolist

options.option_text: A profit‐maximizing monopoly will produce that output for which marginalcost equals marginal revenue
A natural monopoly occurs when one firm can supply the entire market morecheaply than can a number of firms
A monopolist always produces in the elastic region of market demand curve
All of these
